hints.title: Exponential KL-Convergence via Mean-Field Generator Analysis
hints.content:
19: :label: thm-meanfield-lsi-standalone
20: 
21: **Hypotheses**:
22: 
23: 1. **Log-concavity (Axiom 3.5)**: The quasi-stationary distribution has density $\rho_\pi(z) = \exp(-V_{\text{QSD}}(z))$ for convex $V_{\text{QSD}}$
24: 
25: 2. **Fitness-QSD anti-correlation**: There exists $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$ such that:
26:    $$\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$$
27: 
28: 3. **Regularity**: All distributions have smooth densities in $C^2(\Omega)$ with:
29:    - $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho(z) \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$
30:    - $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
31: 
32: 4. **Noise regime**: Cloning noise variance satisfies $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$
33: 
34: 5. **Parameter conditions**: Friction $\gamma > 0$, confining potential convexity $\kappa_{\text{conf}} > 0$, time step $\tau$ sufficiently small
35: 
36: **Conclusion**:
37: 
38: The discrete-time Markov chain $S_{t+1} = \Psi_{\text{total}}(S_t)$ with:
39: $$
40: \Psi_{\text{total}} := \Psi_{\text{clone}} \circ \Psi_{\text{kin}}
41: $$
42: 
43: satisfies exponential convergence in KL divergence:
44: 
45: $$
46: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\lambda t} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + C_\infty
47: $$
48: 
49: where:
50: $$
51: \lambda = \tau(\alpha_{\text{kin}} + \beta_{\text{clone}}) = \tau \cdot O(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} + \lambda_{\text{clone}} \lambda_{\text{corr}})
52: $$
53:

16: ## Main Result
17: 
18: :::{prf:theorem} Exponential KL-Convergence via Mean-Field Generator Analysis
19: :label: thm-meanfield-lsi-standalone
20: 
21: **Hypotheses**:
22: 
23: 1. **Log-concavity (Axiom 3.5)**: The quasi-stationary distribution has density $\rho_\pi(z) = \exp(-V_{\text{QSD}}(z))$ for convex $V_{\text{QSD}}$
24: 
25: 2. **Fitness-QSD anti-correlation**: There exists $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$ such that:
26:    $$\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$$
27: 
28: 3. **Regularity**: All distributions have smooth densities in $C^2(\Omega)$ with:
29:    - $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho(z) \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$
30:    - $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
31: 
32: 4. **Noise regime**: Cloning noise variance satisfies $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$
33: 
34: 5. **Parameter conditions**: Friction $\gamma > 0$, confining potential convexity $\kappa_{\text{conf}} > 0$, time step $\tau$ sufficiently small
35: 
36: **Conclusion**:
37: 
38: The discrete-time Markov chain $S_{t+1} = \Psi_{\text{total}}(S_t)$ with:
39: $$
40: \Psi_{\text{total}} := \Psi_{\text{clone}} \circ \Psi_{\text{kin}}
41: $$
42: 
43: satisfies exponential convergence in KL divergence:
44: 
45: $$
46: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\lambda t} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + C_\infty
47: $$
48: 
49: where:
50: $$

52: $$
53: 
54: and $C_\infty < 0$ for the favorable noise regime.
